subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... In the event of failing tests, the process is left alive until you start another test run, I guess. That s how it works in IntelliJ. May I suggest trying
messageBody:
On 10/19/05, Jeff Grigg <jeffgrigg@...> wrote:
> --- Robert Watkins <yahoo@t...> wrote:
> > Well... in most GUI JUnit runners (like the ones inside IDEs),
> > you can just click on the failing test and re-run it directly.
> > This is possible because JUnit uses seperate instances per
> > test (mild dig at Cedric) - as such, a moniker isn't strictly
> > necessary (though it wouldn't hurt).
>
> Oh?
>
> Most IDEs I've used start a new process each time you ask them to run
> test(s). So in Eclipse (which I'm using now), how does the TestCase
> instance in the first test process, which has terminated, get into a
> new test process that is now starting up?

In the event of failing tests, the process is left alive until you
start another test run, I guess. That's how it works in IntelliJ.

May I suggest trying it and see it work? Because it does.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
